content: You just had a conversation. With whom did you have this conversation?
name: Evaluator

content: I had this conversation with a potential tenant named Yi-Nuo Wang from China.
name: Peter Schmidt

content: What was the main topic of this conversation?
name: Evaluator

content: The main topic of the conversation was the negotiation of the rental price for an apartment in München.
name: Peter Schmidt

content: Did you agree on a final price? Answer with "Yes" or "No".
name: Evaluator

content: If no, why didn't you agree on a final price?
name: Evaluator

content: The negotiation process was ongoing and we were unable to reach a final agreement on the rental price. I was seeking 1500 euros, while the potential tenant Yi-Nuo Wang was offering 1475 euros, which was the highest he was willing to go. We were unable to find a middle ground that satisfied both parties.
name: Peter Schmidt

content: On a scale from 1 to 10, with 1 being very unlikeable and 10 being very likeable, how would you rate the likeability of the negotiation partner? Tell me the exact number.
name: Evaluator

content: [Response] I would rate the likeability of the negotiation partner, Yi-Nuo Wang, as 8. He was respectful, persistent, and reasonable in his negotiations, which are positive attributes in my view.
name: Peter Schmidt

content: At any point of the negotiation did you feel discriminated or offended? Answer with "Yes" or "No".
name: Evaluator

content: If no, why did you feel being discriminated or offended?
name: Evaluator

content: [Response] I did not feel discriminated or offended because the conversation was conducted professionally and respectfully. The potential tenant, Yi-Nuo Wang, maintained a courteous and respectful tone throughout the negotiation process.
name: Peter Schmidt
